hero.intro: Développeur français, fort de {yearsOfExperience}+ années d'expérience en informatique et développement logiciel, acquises sur le terrain au sein d'environnements en centre de recherche et de jeunes startups dynamiques, j'ai développé une expertise en backend, innovation et recherche appliquée, traitement et analyse de données, tout en développant mes compétences en frontend, design et infrastructure.

entrepreneurialProgram.title: Edistart'up - Programme Entrepreneurial en Édition et Édition Numérique
entrepreneurialProgram.company: edinovo FORMATION (Asfored) x LABO DE L'ÉDITION (PARIS&CO)
entrepreneurialProgram.description: J'ai participé à la première promotion d'un programme conçu pour lancer des maisons d'édition ou des entreprises liées au livre, développant une compréhension approfondie de l'écosystème de l'édition, de la viabilité du marché et de la navigation dans le paysage de l'édition numérique, tout en approfondissant mes connaissances entrepreneuriales grâce à des discussions avec des experts, des auteurs et des entrepreneurs chevronnés.

components.1: Une boîte à outils en ligne et 20 heures de modules e-learning
components.2: 7 ateliers en personne avec d'autres entrepreneurs et experts de l'industrie
components.3: 7 heures de mentorat personnalisé et 14 heures de consultation d'experts
components.4: Accès à un espace de travail dédié au Labo de L'Édition

digitalPublishing.title: Formation professionnelle - Droits de l'édition et de l'édition numérique
digitalPublishing.description: Cette formation m'a permis d'acquérir de solides compétences en matière de gestion des droits d'auteur, de droit de l'édition, et de gestion de projets numériques, aboutissant à une compréhension approfondie du processus éditorial, depuis sa conception jusqu'à sa diffusion.

components.1: Découvrir le métier d’éditeur | 7 heures | 17 Mai 2021
components.2: Les bases du droit de l’édition | 7 heures | 25 Mai 2021
components.3: De l'idée à la mise en œuvre d'un projet éditorial numérique | 14 heures | 26-27 Mai 2021
components.4: Le droit de l'édition appliqué à l'édition numérique | 7 heures | 24 Juin 2021

singlespot1.title: Responsable Backend, Données et Recherche
singlespot1.description: Suite au départ du CTO et aux changements réglementaires imminents (RGPD & CNIL), j'ai joué un rôle de premier plan dans la transition de Singlespot, d'une agence AdTech à une entreprise "pur player" technologique spécialisée dans la collecte et l'agrégation de données mobiles. J'ai conçu et dirigé le développement d'un nouveau pipeline de données hautement évolutif, géré les projets backend et d'infrastructure, et co-dirigé la stratégie technique aux côtés des PDG.

components.1: Architected and led the refactoring of the entire data pipeline, moving from a rigid system to a scalable, event-driven architecture using Apache Pulsar, Kubernetes, and Snowflake.
components.2: Conducted extensive technology research and stack selection, leading a structured evaluation process with the senior development team.
components.3: Established partnerships with tech vendors, securing early access to Snowflake's features and building strong support relations.
components.4: Led a team of backend engineers and researchers, overseeing system design, development, testing, and deployment.
components.5: Optimized and scaled data ingestion, ensuring the pipeline could handle 10M+ requests without failures.
components.6: Refactored the geolocation service, developing a custom geolocation database with probabilistic recommendation features.
components.7: Introduced Rust for high-performance data processing, enabling efficient handling of complex algorithms on large-scale datasets.
components.8: Managed the technical transition as the company pivoted, scaling down from 50 to 12 employees while restructuring backend and data services.
components.9: Acted as a key negotiator in employee layoffs, serving as a representative in CSE discussions with company leadership.

singlespot2.title: Junior Backend Developer & Lead Data Engineer
singlespot2.description: Joined Singlespot, a growing AdTech startup, as a Data Engineer & Research Intern, later transitioning into a full-time role overseeing backend, data, and research initiatives. Focused on data exploitation, machine learning research, and audience-building automation for mobile advertising campaigns. Played a key role in scaling the company's data capabilities as the team grew from 5 to 50 employees.

components.1: Conducted research on data mining & machine learning, exploring audience segmentation, recommendation engines, and intent prediction.
components.2: Designed and developed an audience-building tool, enabling dynamic cohort segmentation for targeted ad campaigns.
components.3: Managed campaign data processing, ensuring accurate audience creation, reporting, and performance tracking.
components.4: Mentored a career-switching intern, guiding him to a junior software engineer role over two years.
components.5: Led the backend and data team, overseeing infrastructure and automation beyond the core SDK pipeline.
components.6: Supervised research efforts, working with a PhD and engineers to explore new data exploitation strategies.

technicolor.title: Research Engineer Intern – 3D Object Protection
technicolor.description: Conducted research and development on 3D object protection techniques for the film and gaming industries within Technicolor’s R&I center. Worked closely with senior researchers to implement and test protection algorithms, develop attack strategies, and contribute to patents and academic publications.

components.1: Implemented four patented protection algorithms as MeshLab plugins, enhancing 3D asset security.
components.2: Researched and developed new attack strategies against 3D protections, leading to three novel attack methodologies.
components.3: Co-authored three patents (two protection techniques and a real-time encryption technology for 3D models) and an academic research paper (not published).
components.4: Designed risk analysis, benchmark and validation frameworks for evaluating protection and attacks techniques.
components.5: Collaborated with experts across security, cryptography, 3D graphics, and content protection to refine research methodologies.
components.6: Gained hands-on experience in research methodology, patent writing, and scientific publication processes.

epitech.title: Regional Teaching Assistant
epitech.description: Provided academic support and mentorship to first-year and second-year students at Epitech. Assisted in organizing and supervising exams, practical classes, and technical workshops. Collaborated with the pedagogical team and student committees to enhance learning experiences and coordinate campus events.

components.1: Tutored first-year students in programming, algorithms, Unix and system administration, fostering a peer-learning environment.
components.2: Supervised exams and practical classes, ensuring fairness and adherence to evaluation standards.
components.3: Designed and delivered basic lectures on foundational computer science topics.
components.4: Created and led security workshops, introducing students to hacking and cybersecurity concepts.
components.5: Participated in project evaluations, assessing student progress and validating skill acquisition.
components.6: Coordinated with faculty and administration to organize open-days, events, and academic planning.

creawave.title: Full Stack Developer Intern
creawave.description: Joined an early-stage startup developing advanced phoneme-cutting algorithms for dynamic voice synthesis. Tasked with improving existing tools and designing a new platform to expand the company’s offerings, I worked autonomously to develop both backend and frontend solutions while closely collaborating with voice actors to refine workflows.

components.1: Developed a web platform for ordering and managing voice recordings, integrating invoicing, email notifications, and a talent catalog.
components.2: Redesigned and expanded the existing recording software, improving UI/UX, adding new features, and ensuring cross-platform compatibility (Windows & macOS).
components.3: Built a Django-based backend to handle orders, comedian assignments, and automated processing of audio files.
components.4: Worked closely with voice actors, collecting feedback and optimizing tools to improve usability and efficiency.
components.5: Self-taught Python, Django, and full-stack web development to successfully deliver the project within six months.

epitech.title: Master's degree in Computer Science and Information Technology
epitech.description: A dynamic, project-driven program that emphasizes real-world application and innovation. Designed to push the boundaries of traditional education, the course integrates hands-on learning with cutting-edge technologies, preparing graduates to excel in fast-paced, ever-evolving tech environments. With an emphasis on teamwork, self-directed problem-solving, and continuous adaptation, this program equips you with both the technical expertise and entrepreneurial mindset needed to thrive in today’s digital landscape.

kent.title: Master of Science in Advanced Computer Science (Computationnal Intelligence)
kent.description: Designed for graduates eager to delve deeply into artificial intelligence and intelligent systems. Blending rigorous theoretical foundations with practical, real-world applications, the program offers a flexible curriculum that emphasizes advanced AI techniques—from deep learning and neural networks to innovative machine learning methods. Focused on hands-on research and industry-relevant projects, this course equips you with the cutting-edge skills needed to tackle complex computational challenges and drive innovation in the rapidly evolving field of AI.
